### Other Notes

These are a few books that I am working on to summarise my education in Political Science and Poltiical Economy. **NOTE: THESE ARE IN PROGRESS** - they are being continuously updated, and are not final

1.  [**Political Econometrics**: Using Statistics for Political Science and Political Economy](https://kevinli03.github.io/politicaleconomy/1.pdf)
2.  [**Political Game Theory**: Introduction to Formal Mathematical Models](https://kevinli03.github.io/politicaleconomy/2.pdf)
3.  [**Political Economy**: Using Economic Models to Study Politics](https://kevinli03.github.io/politicaleconomy/3.pdf)
4.  [**Advanced Statistical Methods**: Further Regression, Time Series, and Latent Variables](https://kevinli03.github.io/politicaleconomy/4.pdf)
5.  [**Social Data Science**: Using Machine Learning for Political Science and Political Economy](https://kevinli03.github.io/politicaleconomy/5.pdf)

Finally, a companion book: [Mathematics for Political Economy](https://kevinli03.github.io/politicaleconomy/maths.pdf)

### GV4C8 Game Theory

**GV4C8 Game Theory for Political Science**

[Lecturer]{.underline}: Professor Rafael Hortala-Vallve

[Formative Assessment]{.underline}: Weekly Problem Sets, Week 11 Mock Exam

[Summative Assessment]{.underline}: Problem Set 1 (25%, AT W7), Problem Set 2 (25%, AT W11) Exam (50%, Spring)

<br />

Course Content (Lectures, Readings, Problems):

1.  [Political Economy, Game Theory, Aggregation of Preferences](https://kevinli03.github.io/notes/GV4C8/1.html)
2.  [Nash Equilibrium, Static Games of Complete Information](https://kevinli03.github.io/notes/GV4C8/2.html) \| [Problem Set Week 2](https://kevinli03.github.io/notes/GV4C8/problems/2.pdf)
3.  [Downsian Models of Electoral Competition](https://kevinli03.github.io/notes/GV4C8/3.html) \| Problem Set Week 3
4.  Mixed Strategies, Strategic Foresight
5.  Dynamic Games of Complete Information, Legislative Bargaining

7.  Elections as Incentive Devices, Counter-terrorism, Repeated Games
8.  Imperfect and Incomplete Information, Bayesian Nash Equilibrium

10. Signalling and Elections as Accountability Mechanism
